summary: This bill, the Parity for Tribal Law Enforcement Act (H.R. 4712), amends the Indian Law Enforcement Reform Act to enhance public safety in Indian communities. It grants tribal law enforcement officers authority to enforce federal law, provided they meet specific training, background check, and certification requirements. The bill also addresses oversight, coordination, and accountability of Department of Justice activities concerning public safety in Indian communities, including mandates for reporting, training, data analysis, and improvement of operational plans.
